title: The Miracle on Alley Nine
location: Temple District -> The Temple of the Old Light
description: A beggar woman in Alley Nine claims to have been cured of her chronic leg ailment after touching a crumbling Temple wall. Within twenty-four hours, twenty more citizens are touching the wall, and the Temple priests are split between genuine faith and suspicion of a hoax.

turns.narrative: Mirra is walking without a stick for the first time she can clearly remember. Brother Daan examines her leg with a physician's eye and cannot find anything obviously fake. Sister Enne is joyful and certain this is divine. Twenty citizens are kneeling at the wall.
turns.choice_a: Ask Alchemist Rynn to examine the wall's stone composition for any non-spiritual explanation
turns.consequence_a: The wall contains trace amounts of Thermic Clay — a geothermally-formed mineral with mild analgesic and muscle-relaxing properties when warm.
turns.choice_b: Find and interview anyone who saw what happened to Mirra at the moment of healing
turns.consequence_b: A market boy saw Mirra sit and lean against the warm wall for nearly three hours before she stood and walked. Duration of thermic contact, not miracle.

turns.narrative: The scientific explanation is plausible but does not definitively rule out a miraculous component. And Mirra is genuinely healed — whatever the cause.
turns.choice_a: Present the Thermic Clay explanation to both priests and let them integrate it into their theology as they see fit
turns.consequence_a: Sister Enne declares it 'the Lord's grace expressed through good stone.' Brother Daan is satisfied with the science. Both are content.
turns.choice_b: Recommend keeping the explanation private to avoid undermining citizens' faith
turns.consequence_b: Only the Temple priests know the full picture. The miracle narrative continues publicly.

turns.narrative: The wall is now a pilgrimage point. Its thermic properties need to be managed safely.
turns.choice_a: Advise the Temple to allow controlled short-term contact sessions and monitor medical outcomes
turns.consequence_a: The Temple runs evening contact sessions. Two more citizens with chronic pain report meaningful relief.
turns.choice_b: Recommend the wall simply remains accessible as it was — people will regulate themselves
turns.consequence_b: The unofficial pilgrimage continues. The Temple accepts donations and the alley becomes a minor landmark.

sessions_organised.description: Controlled thermic contact sessions organised. Two more citizens helped.

access_remains.description: Wall remains publicly accessible. Minor pilgrimage site established.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

loot_table: Temple of the Old Light Prayer Token
conclusion: Controlled thermic contact sessions organised. Two more citizens helped.
